intro: Salsola aptera, commonly known as Russian thistle or goatweed, is a flowering plant in the Amaranthaceae family. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant has small, scale-like leaves and produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers. It is well adapted to harsh conditions, with a deep root system and the ability to survive drought. Salsola aptera is often considered a weed but plays a role in stabilizing soil in disturbed areas.
